problem.markdown:
>>1) With increasing sampling frequency fs, the mean square error of the reconstructed output w.r.t the original signal<< (x) increases. ( ) remains uneffected. ( ) almost zero. ( ) remains constant after initial decrease.
>>2) From the observation in exp-4(c) what can you say about the delay introduced in the reconstructed output w.r.t original signal by the first order hold ?<< ( ) No delay is introduced (x) A delay of one sample period is introduced ( ) A delay of two sample periods is introduced
>>3) The main cause of aliasing distortion observed in frequency domain in sampling of a continuous time signal is<< ( ) the signal spectra being band-limited. ( ) the signal spectra being non band-limited. (x) sampling in time domain.
>>4) Linear interpolation based reconstruction process<< ( ) maintains the value of the previous sampling instant till next sampling instant. (x) joins the adjacent sampling points by a straight line. ( ) joins the adjacent sampling points by a second-order polynomial.
>>5)The role of zero padding in DFT based signal analysis is<< ( ) to reduce the aliasing distortion. ( ) to increase the frequency resolution (x) to reduce the picket fence effect
>>6) What is over sampling ?<< ( ) Sampling a signal with sampling frequency significantly higher than the bandwidth of the signal being sampled. ( ) Sampling a signal with sampling frequency significantly lower than the bandwidth of the signal being sampled. (x) Sampling a signal with sampling frequency significantly higher than twice the bandwidth of the signal being sampled. ( ) Sampling a signal with sampling frequency three times higher than the bandwidth of the signal being sampled.
>>7) From the observation in exp-4(c) what can you make out about delay introduce by zero order hold ?<< (x) Zero ( ) One ( ) Two
>>8) What do you mean by under sampling ?<< ( ) Sampling the signal at Nyquist rate. (x) Sampling the signal below the Nyquist rate. ( ) Sampling the signal greater than or equal to Nyquist rate.
>>9) What is the use of anti-aliasing filter ?<< ( ) It is used for reconstruction of a signal. (x) It is used to restrict the bandwidth of a signal to satisfy the sampling theorem and to prevent aliasing.
>>10) A signal can be reconstructed from its samples by using which method?<< (x) Filtering. ( ) Resampling. ( ) Auto-correlation.
>>11) Computation of DFT involves<< ( ) Sampling in time domain. (x) Sampling in frequency domain. ( ) No sampling. ( ) Sampling in both time and frequency domain.
>>12) What should be done to resolve two very closely spaced sinusoids presents in a signal?<< ( ) Small data length with appropriate zero padding must be done. (x) Length of data sufficiently large should be taken.
